content:
Day 1:

Breakfast:

1. Russ & Daughters Cafe (Lower East Side) - Try their bagels with lox, cream cheese and capers
2. Clinton St. Baking Company (Lower East Side) - Try their fluffy pancakes or eggs benedict

Activities:

1. Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island Tour - Take the subway to Bowling Green (4,5) and take the Statue of Liberty Ferry from Battery Park.
2. 9/11 Memorial & Museum - Take the subway to World Trade Center (E)
3. Central Park - Take the subway to 59th St - Columbus Circle (A,B,C,D)

Lunch:

1. Prince Street Pizza (Soho) - Try their famous pepperoni slice
2. Xi'an Famous Foods (Various locations) - Try their hand-pulled noodles

Dinner:

1. Peter Luger Steak House (Brooklyn) - Try their signature porterhouse steak
2. Carbone (Greenwich Village) - Try their rigatoni alla vodka or veal parmesan

Day 2:

Breakfast:

1. The Smith (Various locations) - Try their avocado toast or eggs benedict
2. Sarabeth's (Central Park South) - Try their lemon ricotta pancakes or eggs florentine

Activities:

1. The Metropolitan Museum of Art - Take the subway to 86th St (4,5,6)
2. Brooklyn Bridge & DUMBO - Take the subway to Brooklyn Bridge - City Hall (4,5,6) and walk across the bridge to DUMBO.
3. Broadway Show - Take the subway to Times Square - 42nd St (N,Q,R,W,1,2,3,7,S)

Lunch:

1. Shake Shack (Various locations) - Try their classic ShackBurger
2. Los Tacos No. 1 (Chelsea Market) - Try their adobada tacos or quesadillas

Dinner:

1. Le Bernardin (Midtown West) - Try their seafood tasting menu
2. Babbo (Greenwich Village) - Try their pasta tasting menu

Day 3:

Breakfast:

1. Buvette (West Village) - Try their croissants or waffles
2. Joe's Pizza (Greenwich Village) - Try their classic cheese slice

Activities:

1. Empire State Building - Take the subway to 34th St - Herald Square (B,D,F,M,N,Q,R,W)
2. High Line & Chelsea Market - Take the subway to 14th St (A,C,E,L) and walk to the High Line.
3. Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) - Take the subway to 5th Ave - 53rd St (E,M)

Lunch:

1. Katz's Delicatessen (Lower East Side) - Try their pastrami sandwich or matzo ball soup
2. Artichoke Basille's Pizza (Various locations) - Try their artichoke pizza

Dinner:

1. Eleven Madison Park (Flatiron District) - Try their tasting menu
2. Momofuku Noodle Bar (East Village) - Try their pork buns or ramen

Transportation:
The best way to navigate New York City is through its subway system. You can buy a MetroCard at any subway station, which can be used for both the subway and the bus. Google Maps or the MTA website can help you plan your route.
